            "title": [
              ["The above command will recursively find all directories ("],
              ["-type d", [["c"]]],
              [") relative to "],
              [".", [["c"]]],
              [" (which is your current working directory), and execute "],
              ["chmod 770", [["c"]]],
              [" on them. The "],
              ["-r", [["c"]]],
              [" option specifies to "],
              ["xargs", [["c"]]],
              [" to not run "],
              ["chmod", [["c"]]],
              [" if "],
              ["find", [["c"]]],
              [" did not find any files."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["This way, the "],
              ["-exec", [["c"]]],
              [
                " receives the file names in a form which is completely correct and portable; the "
              ],
              ["bash -c", [["c"]]],
              [
                " receives them as a number of arguments, which will be found in "
              ],
              [
                "$@",
                [
                  ["c"],
                  [
                    "a",
                    "/documentation/bash/4797/internal-variables/16891/%24%40"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ", correctly quoted etc. (The script will need to handle these names correctly, of course; every variable which contains a file name needs to be in double quotes.)"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "version": 5
